org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.etsits103097.v131.validator

Class ETSI103097PermissionValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.ieee1609dot2.validator.BasePermissionValidator
      • org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.etsits103097.v131.validator.ETSI103097PermissionValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PermissionValidator

    public class ETSI103097PermissionValidator
extends BasePermissionValidator
    Permission validator for evaluating app and cert issue permissions of ETSI 103 097 Certificates.

    It also contains extra method to check specific permissions for the SecuredCertificateRequestService (623)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ETSI103097PermissionValidator()
      Constructor used for validators in a PKI with no known default SSP values.
      ETSI103097PermissionValidator(DefaultSSPLookup defaultSSPLookup)
      Constructor used in PKIs with known default SSP values used when PSIDSSP contains empty SSP data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ETSI103097PermissionValidator

        public ETSI103097PermissionValidator()
        Constructor used for validators in a PKI with no known default SSP values. Initializes itself with an EmptyDefaultSSPLookup.

      • ETSI103097PermissionValidator

        public ETSI103097PermissionValidator(DefaultSSPLookup defaultSSPLookup)
        Constructor used in PKIs with known default SSP values used when PSIDSSP contains empty SSP data.
        Parameters:
        defaultSSPLookup - lookup implementation of default SSP values for specific SSP and SSPRanges.

    • Method Detail

      • checkPermissions

        public void checkPermissions(EndEntityType targetEndEntityType,
                             Certificate[] certificateChain,
                             boolean entireChain)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             InvalidCertificateException
        Method to validate permissions in a certificate chain that starts with an end entity certificate. It will check all permissions set in the certificate for the given end entity type.
        Parameters:
        targetEndEntityType - the target end entity type to validate.
        certificateChain - the certificate chain with end entity certificate first.
        entireChain - if entireChain should be validated or only first certificate in chain.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the specified parameters was invalid.
        InvalidCertificateException - if certificate chain contained invalid permissions.

      • checkPermissions

        public void checkPermissions(EndEntityType targetEndEntityType,
                             int chainLengthIndex,
                             Certificate[] certificateChain,
                             boolean entireChain)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             InvalidCertificateException
        Special use-case method to validate permissions in a certificate chain that starts with a ca certificate. It will check all permissions set in the certificate for the given end entity type.
        Parameters:
        targetEndEntityType - the target end entity type to validate.
        chainLengthIndex - index parameter send to retrieve the correct group permissions from certificate. If validating chain that starts with end entity certificate should chainLengthIndex be 0, if certificate chain starts with issuer of end entity certificate it should be 1 and so on incremented up to root certificate in chain.
        certificateChain - the certificate chain with end entity certificate first.
        entireChain - if entireChain should be validated or only first certificate in chain.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the specified parameters was invalid.
        InvalidCertificateException - if certificate chain contained invalid permissions.

      • checkCertServicePermissionInAppPermissions

        public void checkCertServicePermissionInAppPermissions(byte ssPVersion,
                                                       byte ssPPermissions,
                                                       Certificate[] certificateChain)
                                                throws InvalidCertificateException
        Method to check if the first certificate in supplied chain have a specific appPermission set in its SecuredCertificateRequestService (623) SSP Data.
        Parameters:
        ssPVersion - the version byte of the SSP Data (Use SecuredCertificateRequestServicePermissions.VERSION_ constants)
        ssPPermissions - the permission to look up in the SSP Data (Use SecuredCertificateRequestServicePermission constants)
        certificateChain - the certificate chain to check permission, only the first certificate that have its certificate checked.
        Throws:
        InvalidCertificateException - if given permission wasn't found in the certificate.

      • checkCertServicePermissionInIssuePermissions

        public void checkCertServicePermissionInIssuePermissions(byte ssPVersion,
                                                         byte ssPPermissions,
                                                         EndEntityType endEntityType,
                                                         int chainLengthIndex,
                                                         Certificate[] certificateChain)
                                                  throws InvalidCertificateException
        Method to check if the first certificate in supplied chain have a specific certIssuePermission set in its SecuredCertificateRequestService (623) SSP Data.
        Parameters:
        ssPVersion - the version byte of the SSP Data (Use SecuredCertificateRequestServicePermissions.VERSION_ constants)
        ssPPermissions - the permission to look up in the SSP Data (Use SecuredCertificateRequestServicePermission constants)
        endEntityType - the end entity type to lookup
        chainLengthIndex - index parameter send to retrieve the correct group permissions from certificate. If validating chain that starts with end entity certificate should chainLengthIndex be 0, if certificate chain starts with issuer of end entity certificate it should be 1 and so on incremented up to root certificate in chain.
        certificateChain - the certificate chain to lookup cert issuer permissions if the first certificate.
        Throws:
        InvalidCertificateException - if no given permissions was found in certificate.

      • checkPermissions

        protected void checkPermissions(EndEntityType endEntityType,
                                int chainLength,
                                Certificate certificate,
                                Certificate issuer)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                InvalidCertificateException
        Help method to check app and cert issue permission of an certificate against permissions in its issuer. If certificate contains certRequestPermissions is InvalidCertificateException thrown since it is not supported in ETSI 103097 PKIs.
        Parameters:
        endEntityType - the end entity type to evaluate permissions for.
        chainLength - the current index in the chain evaulation, starts at 0 and is incremented.
        certificate - the certificate to check permissions for towards it issuer
        issuer - the issuer certificate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the parameter contained invalid data.
        InvalidCertificateException - if certificate contained invalid permissions.
